div1.p: Parker requests Carter's opinion on his formula for the economic loss caused by malaria in Mississippi.

Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
I am working up data relative to the economic and commercial
bearing malaria has in Mississippi. With the information available it is rather
difficult to arrive at some satisfactory conclusions. In computing the economic
loss per acre of improved farm land I have worked out the following, and if con-
venient to you may I ask your opinion regarding it:

div1.p: (1.92 x .20) plus 1.92 = $2.30 Gross economic loss per acre improved farm land.

Computing the annual cost per acre of improved farm land based on the number
of malaria cases times $25.00 gives $0.35.

While in Chattanooga I met Dr. Hansen who was in Panama and later in Peru.
I would like to keep in touch with him, and will appreciate it if you will let me
know his initials and general address.

Thank you most kindly for your consideration of this matter, and with kindest
regards.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, George Parker. Answered - again Dec 17.
